AboutText: Mohammad Zeyad is associated with Laboratory AVENUES, Department of Urban Engineering at Université de Technologie de Compiègne (UTC) as a Doctoral (Ph.D.) Researcher (Oct 2023–present), which is funded by France’s Ministries of Higher Education and Research (MESR). Also, he is engaged as the Head of the Energy and Technology Research Division at ABCD Laboratory, Bangladesh. In 2022, he completed the Erasmus Mundus Joint MSc in Smart Cities and Communities from Heriot-Watt University, UK. Although, in 2019, he joined as an Advisory Panel Member in ELSEVIER and Convenor & Member (National Committee) of the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC). He has 35+ published papers in different scientific journals (Elsevier, Wiley, Oxford University Press, Springer Nature, etc.) and conferences (IEEE flagship conferences) which are indexed by Web of Science, Scopus, and many more. Currently, almost 10+ national and international students and researchers are conducting their research under the supervision of Mohammad Zeyad in the ABCD Laboratory, Bangladesh. However, his primary research interest is in Renewable Energy, Microgrid, Energy Storage, Electricity Market, Smart Cities, HVAC Systems, Energy Efficiency, Optimization, Energy Economics, and Power Electronics.

AboutText: I have received the prestigious Erasmus Mundus Scholarship and have recently started my 2 years master's in Membrane Engineering for Sustainable Development, MESD, Edition (2023-2025). I completed my BSc degree in Applied Chemistry and Chemical Engineering in 2022 from the University of Rajshahi, Bangladesh. Currently, I am working with Prof. Mohammad Taufiq Alam and Dr. Boshir Research Group as a Graduate Research Assistant to gain an in-depth understanding of the uses of nanomaterials as a catalyst on the surface of membranes. My research interests are biocatalysts, Biopolymers, Nanomaterials, Membrane Materials, Electro spinning, and Membranes for Energy and water treatment.

AboutText: I am Roquia Salam, and my academic background is rooted in Disaster Management, with both my Bachelor of Science (BSc) and Master of Science (MSc) degrees obtained from Begum Rokeya University, Rangpur (BRUR), Bangladesh. Subsequently, I have had the privilege of completing a second master's degree through the esteemed Erasmus Mundus Joint Master's program in Geospatial Technologies. Upon the completion of this master's program in March 2024, I have embarked on a doctoral journey at the University College London (UCL), UK, furthering my research and academic pursuits in this field.

M A U Shariff is a distinguished computer scientist, holding a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Nebraska–Lincoln, where he excelled in AI, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning. His impactful research, notably in regional dialect identification and air quality prediction, reflects his innovative contributions to the field. Beyond academia, Shariff is a dedicated educator, leveraging his expertise as a Graduate Teaching Assistant to foster student success. His leadership extends beyond the classroom, as evidenced by his community involvement and compassionate initiatives, showcasing his commitment to making a positive impact.
